| An ogre emperor:* has [a head, a couple of arms, and a torso](/wiki/Humanoid "Humanoid").
* is [carnivorous](/wiki/Carnivore "Carnivore").
* is not a valid [polymorphable](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph") form.
* is an orc.
* is an [overlord to its kind](/wiki/M2_PRINCE "M2 PRINCE").
* is male.
* is [strong](/wiki/Strong "Strong").
* [likes gold](/wiki/Gold_lover "Gold lover").
* likes gems.
* can pick up weapons and food.
* can be seen through [infravision](/wiki/Infravision "Infravision"). |                            |

An **ogre emperor**, O, is a [monster](/wiki/Monster "Monster") that appears in [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack") and [notdNetHack](/wiki/NotdNetHack "NotdNetHack"). He is a [strong](/wiki/Strong "Strong") [ogre](/wiki/Ogre_\(monster_class\) "Ogre (monster class)") that is also [orcish](/wiki/Orc_\(monster_attribute\) "Orc (monster attribute)"); an ogre emperor can also be seen via [infravision](/wiki/Infravision "Infravision"), will seek out and pick up [gold](/wiki/Gold "Gold"), [gems](/wiki/Gem "Gem") and other items, and is an [overlord](/wiki/M2_PRINCE "M2 PRINCE") to his kind.

An ogre emperor has a strong weapon attack.

## Generation

Ogre emperors are not randomly generated, and are not a valid form for normal [polymorph](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph").

Only one ogre emperor normally appears in the [Mordor Ruins variant](/wiki/Mordor_Ruins_Quest "Mordor Ruins Quest") of the [Chaos Quest](/wiki/Chaos_Quest_\(dNetHack\) "Chaos Quest (dNetHack)"). The ogre emperor resides in a [throne room](/wiki/Throne_room "Throne room") within the eastern section of the Mordor Fortress, sitting on the [throne](/wiki/Throne "Throne") himself. He carries [The Mantle of Wrath](/wiki/The_Mantle_of_Wrath "The Mantle of Wrath"), an [artifact](/wiki/Artifact "Artifact") [orcish cloak](/wiki/Orcish_cloak "Orcish cloak"), and is also [generated with](/wiki/Monster_starting_inventory "Monster starting inventory") a [tsurugi](/wiki/Tsurugi "Tsurugi") and a [war hat](/wiki/War_hat "War hat"). As an overlord to his kind, the tsurugi will always be at least +1, and the armor will be at least +0.

## Strategy

A character strong enough to fight their way to the ogre emperor should be more than capable of defeating him after clearing out the assorted orcs and other monsters in his court - the most that some characters might need to look out for is his [MR score](/wiki/Magic_resistance_\(monster\) "Magic resistance (monster)") of 90 if they are playing a magic-reliant build.

- *This page is a **[stub](/wiki/Category:Stubs "Category:Stubs")**. Should you wish to do so, you can contribute by [**expanding this page**.](https://nethackwiki.com/index.php?title=Ogre_emperor\&action=edit)*

[![This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.](/images/5/5d/Nh343var-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.")
html:
Ogre emperor

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
O ogre emperor (No tile)
Difficulty 15
Attacks Weapon 4d5 physical
O ogre emperor (No tile)
Difficulty 15
Attacks

Weapon 4d5 physical

Base level 13
Base experience 358
Speed 16
Base AC 4
Base MR 90
Alignment -9 (chaotic)
Frequency (by normal means) 0 (Not randomly generated)
Genocidable Yes
Weight 2800
Nutritional value 800
Size large
Resistances none
Resistances conveyed none

An ogre emperor:

  • has a head, a couple of arms, and a torso.
  • is carnivorous.
  • is not a valid polymorphable form.
  • is an orc.
  • is an overlord to its kind.
  • is male.
  • is strong.
  • likes gold.
  • likes gems.
  • can pick up weapons and food.
  • can be seen through infravision.

An ogre emperor, O, is a monster that appears in dNetHack and notdNetHack. He is a strong ogre that is also orcish; an ogre emperor can also be seen via infravision, will seek out and pick up gold, gems and other items, and is an overlord to his kind.

An ogre emperor has a strong weapon attack.

Generation

Ogre emperors are not randomly generated, and are not a valid form for normal polymorph.

Only one ogre emperor normally appears in the Mordor Ruins variant of the Chaos Quest. The ogre emperor resides in a throne room within the eastern section of the Mordor Fortress, sitting on the throne himself. He carries The Mantle of Wrath, an artifact orcish cloak, and is also generated with a tsurugi and a war hat. As an overlord to his kind, the tsurugi will always be at least +1, and the armor will be at least +0.

Strategy

A character strong enough to fight their way to the ogre emperor should be more than capable of defeating him after clearing out the assorted orcs and other monsters in his court - the most that some characters might need to look out for is his MR score of 90 if they are playing a magic-reliant build.

This page is a stub. Should you wish to do so, you can contribute by expanding this page.

An '''ogre emperor''', {{magenta|O}}, is a [[monster]] that appears in [[dNetHack]] and [[notdNetHack]]. He is a [[strong]] [[Ogre (monster class)|ogre]] that is also [[Orc (monster attribute)|orcish]]; an ogre emperor can also be seen via [[infravision]], will seek out and pick up [[gold]], [[gem]]s and other items, and is an [[M2_PRINCE|overlord]] to his kind.

An ogre emperor has a strong weapon attack.

==Generation==
Ogre emperors are not randomly generated, and are not a valid form for normal [[polymorph]].

Only one ogre emperor normally appears in the [[Mordor Ruins Quest|Mordor Ruins variant]] of the [[Chaos Quest (dNetHack)|Chaos Quest]]. The ogre emperor resides in a [[throne room]] within the eastern section of the Mordor Fortress, sitting on the [[throne]] himself. He carries [[The Mantle of Wrath]], an [[artifact]] [[orcish cloak]], and is also [[Monster starting inventory|generated with]] a [[tsurugi]] and a [[war hat]]. As an overlord to his kind, the tsurugi will always be at least +1, and the armor will be at least +0.

==Strategy==
A character strong enough to fight their way to the ogre emperor should be more than capable of defeating him after clearing out the assorted orcs and other monsters in his court - the most that some characters might need to look out for is his [[Magic resistance (monster)|MR score]] of 90 if they are playing a magic-reliant build.
